sen.j: なぎとは平坦な安定した状態をあらわし、古語でもある。
sen.e: Nagi is the Japanese word that indicates the state of flat and stable condition and it is also an archaic word.
Nagi is the Japanese word that indicates the state of flat and stable condition and it is also an archaic word.
Nagi is the Japanese word that indicates the state of flat and stable condition and it is also an archaic word.

sen.j: 「なぎ」という発音が先にあり、あとから様々に漢字が当てられた。
sen.e: The pronunciation of 'nagi' preceded, and later various Chinese characters were given to it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The pronunciation of 'nagi' preceded and later, various Chinese characters were assigned to it.
sen.cmt: ,の位置をかえました。Assignedにしました。

sen.j: 意味のあるものとしては、和ぎ・凪・薙ぎとも表記する。
sen.e: As meaningful descriptions, nagi is also described as '和ぎ, 凪, 薙ぎ.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As meaningful descriptions, nagi is also described as '和ぎ, 凪, 薙ぎ.'
As meaningful descriptions, nagi is also described as '和ぎ, 凪, 薙ぎ.'

sen.j: 反対語として荒れや波や起伏がある。
sen.e: As antonyms, '荒れ (are: roughness),' '波 (nami: waves)' and '起伏 (kifuku: ups and downs)' exist.
As antonyms, '荒れ (are: roughness),' '波 (nami: waves)' and '起伏 (kifuku: ups and downs)' exist.

sen.j: 概要

sen.j: 和ぎ・凪・薙ぎと表記したときの意味合いの別。
sen.e: The differences of meaning when nagi is described as '和, 凪, 薙ぎ.'
The differences of meaning when nagi is described as '和, 凪, 薙ぎ.'

sen.j: 「和ぎ」とは、和やかであり穏やかであり、おもに心情や情勢に用いられる。
sen.e: 和ぎ' means friendly and calm and is used mainly to indicate the mentality and state or environment.
和ぎ' means friendly and calm and is used mainly to describe the mentality and state or environment.
和ぎ' means friendly and calm and is used mainly to describe the mentality and state or environment.

sen.j: 「凪」とは、和ぎと同意でもあるが、現在では、風が無く穏やかな波のない海の状態をさす場合が多い。
sen.e: 凪' has the similar meaning to '和ぎ,' but today it often indicates the calm state of the sea without wind and waves.
凪' has the similar meaning to '和ぎ,' but today it often describes the calm state of the sea without wind and waves.
凪' has the similar meaning to '和ぎ,' but today it often describes the calm state of the sea without wind and waves.

sen.j: また、数少ない国字（和製漢字）であり風が止まっている状態をあらわしている。
sen.e: And the Chinese character used for '凪' is one of the few kokuji (Chinese characters invented in Japan) that indicate the state that the wind has stopped.
And the Chinese character used for '凪' is one of the few kokuji (Chinese characters invented in Japan) that describe the state that the wind has stopped.
And the Chinese character used for '凪' is one of the few kokuji (Chinese characters invented in Japan) that describe the state that the wind has stopped.

sen.j: 「薙ぎ」とは、山が崩れ平らになりつつある状態や、草木を刈った平坦な野原をさす。
sen.e: 薙ぎ (nagi)' indicates the state that a mountain has collapsed and is being flattened, or a flat field where grass and trees have been cut off.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: 薙ぎ (nagi)' describes the state that a mountain has collapsed and is being flattened, or a flat field where grass and trees have been cut off.
薙ぎ (nagi)' describes the state that a mountain has collapsed and is being flattened, or a flat field where grass and trees have been cut off.

sen.j: だが、横に打ち払う（薙ぎ払う）という意味もあり。
sen.e: And it also has a meaning of slashing something off horizontally.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: And it also has a meaning of slashing something off horizontally.
And it also has a meaning of slashing something off horizontally.

sen.j: そのことから神事としての祓い清めを意味する。
sen.e: From this meaning, it came to mean the exorcisation and purification as a Shinto ritual.
From this meaning, it came to mean the exorcisation and purification as a Shinto ritual.
From this meaning, it came to mean the exorcisation and purification as a Shinto ritual.

sen.j: また薙の神事が日本各地にあり、内陸地方での嵐や大風を鎮める行為とされる。
sen.e: Also Shinto rituals of '薙' exist all over Japan, and it is considered a rite to calm down storms or strong winds in the inland areas.
Also Shinto rituals of '薙' exist all over Japan, and it is considered a rite to calm down storms or strong winds in the inland areas.
Also Shinto rituals of '薙' exist all over Japan, and it is considered a rite to calm down storms or strong winds in the inland areas.

sen.j: 珍しい文字では「𡵢（なぎ）」があり、崩れという意味から薙ぎの当て字である。
sen.e: There is a unusual letter '𡵢 (nagi)' for it which is a phonetic-equivalent character that comes from the meaning of collapsing.
There is a unusual letter '𡵢 (nagi)' for it which is a phonetic-equivalent character that comes from the meaning of collapsing.

sen.j: 「なぎ」には、様々な漢字表記がある。
sen.e: Many Chinese characters are used to describe 'nagi.'

sen.j: 同音異句の樹木や山・地名としても多く使われている。
sen.e: Nagi is also often used to describe the homonyms of trees, mountains and place names.

sen.j: だが、ほとんどが日本の神道や神話や、古神道における信仰の場所に、係わるものである。
sen.e: But the word nagi mostly indicates the things that are involved in Shinto and myths in Japan and the place of worship in the Ancient Shinto.

sen.j: 神籬
sen.e: Hiromogi (a temporarily erected sacred space or "altar" used as a locus of worship)
Hiromogi (a temporarily erected sacred space or "altar" used as a locus of worship)
Hiromogi (a temporarily erected sacred space or "altar" used as a locus of worship)

sen.j: 神籬（ひもろぎ）とは、木や枝葉の依り代のこと。
sen.e: Hiromogi is a yorishiro (object representative of a divine spirit) of trees, branches or leaves.
Hiromogi is a yorishiro (object representative of a divine spirit) of trees, branches, or leaves.
Hiromogi is a yorishiro (object representative of a divine spirit) of trees, branches, or leaves.

sen.j: 古くは岩や山や森林や大木を信仰の対象とした。
sen.e: In the ancient time rocks, mountains and huge trees were the objects of worship.
In the ancient time, rocks, mountains and huge trees were the objects of worship.
In the ancient time, rocks, mountains and huge trees were the objects of worship.

sen.j: 現在は神木と儀式用の榊をさす場合が多い。
sen.e: Nowadays hiromogi often indicates the shinboku (sacred tree) and sakaki (species of evergreen sacred to Shinto) for ritual use.

sen.j: 岩や山の依り代は磐座（いわくら）という傾向にある。
sen.e: The rocks and mountains as yorishiro tend to be called iwakura (dwelling place of a god, usually in reference to a large rock).

sen.j: 南木（なぎ）楠（クスノキ）のことで、南木（なぎ）と名づけ神木として祀っている神社がある。
sen.e: Hiromogi is '南木 (nagi),' or '楠 (camphor tree),' and some shrines name it '南木 (nagi)' and enshrine it as shinboku.
